thread.title: In the Long Run, Fear of Short-Termism Is Mostly Bunk

author: James Mackintosh
title: In the Long Run, Fear of Short-Termism Is Mostly Bunk
text:
The critics of short-termism have it wrong. The evidence doesn’t support the idea that the economy is suffering because shareholders focused on quarterly reports leads to myopic management.
One quarter doesn’t make a trend, but consider the latest quarterly reporting season. Capital spending by S&P 500 companies is expected to be 24% up over the previous year, according to Credit Suisse, even as the wider economy increased business investment only 6%.
